item.title: Install Bspwm
item.description: Install and Configure bspwm What is BSPWM? BSPWM is a tiling window manager that arranges windows in a non-overlapping pattern. It uses a binary space partitioning tree data structure to divide the available screen space into a series of rectangular regions. This allows for optimal utilization of screen real estate and facilitates quick navigation between different applications. Follow these step-by-step instructions to install BSPWM on your Linux system: Install Bspwm Start by installing BSPWM using your package manager.
